title: What is the difference between a subset and an equal set (with examples)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Subset means everything in given set is present in another set but the other set may contain more elements than given set For example let A={1,2,3,4,5} and B={1,2,3,4,5,6,7} here every element in A is in B so we can say that A is subset of B . And B is super set of A But they are not equal two sets are said to be equal if all the elements in A are in B and all the elements in B are in A For example A={1,2,3,4,5} B={1,2,3,4,5} then both the sets are said to be equal

1.1.5 Equal sets Given two sets A and B, if every elements of A is also an element of B and if every element of B is also an element of A, then the sets A and B are said to be equal. ... For example, the set of natural numbers is a subset of set of whole numbers which is a subset of integers.
